result.execSummary:
The defendant William M Bowar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. William M Bowar is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • William M Bowar was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:06 P.M. Defendant William M Bowar in court with attorney John H. Bradley.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of Right to Prelim filed, Court accepts Waiver, probable cause found, bound over, Information filed, waives reading, Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads guilty to Ct. 1, Judgment to be entered, Ct. 2 dismissed, Court sentences defendant to: Ct. 1, Court withholds sentence, probation 2 years, $518.00 costs, 30 days jail w/Huber, jail start date to be at the discretion of probation agent, to be completed w/in 6 months defendant to provide DNA Sample, Defendant to report to probation and parole by 2:30 P.M. today, 1:33 P.M.
